articles.title: Importing a Frontend JavaScript Library Without a Build System
articles.description: Many developers prefer to eschew complex, modern build processes and use JavaScript in a more old-school way. You can definitely get by without a build system, and Julia explores some ways to import libraries in such a setup.
articles.author: Julia Evans

articles.title: Angular v19 Released
articles.description: The latest version of the popular enterprise-scale app framework is here with a ▶️ 22 minute introductory video running through what’s changed and what’s new, including incremental hydration (in preview), two new core reactivity primitives, event replay, and the ability to specify which routes are rendered server or client side.
articles.author: Minko Gechev

articles.title: Exploring JavaScript Symbols
articles.description: Symbols were a new ‘quirky little primitive’ (as Trevor puts it) that arrived with ES6 ten years ago, but they continue to be poorly understood. Trevor boils them down really well, including a little side quest into the likely-to-be-deprecated ‘species.’
articles.author: Trevor I. Lasn

articles.title: Building Self-Contained Executable Programs with Deno
articles.description: One of Deno’s compelling features is its deno compile command that can turn JavaScript and TypeScript programs into single, easy to distribute cross-platform binaries. Here’s a bit more about what makes it tick.
articles.author: Ryan Dahl and Andy Jiang

articles.title: Mapping Over Promises in JavaScript
articles.description: A quick look at three approaches: for..of, Promise.all, and p-map
articles.author: Peter Mbanugo

articles.title: Viselect: Let Users Visually Select DOM Elements
articles.description: If you’ve got a variety of elements and you want users to be able to select them in groups, individually, or even in multiple groups, this lets you offer that functionality easily. Can be used in a vanilla fashion or with integrations for P/React or Vue.js.
articles.author: Simon Reinisch

articles.title: Perfectionist 4: ESLint Plugin for Sorting Things in Your Code
articles.description: It doesn’t care what you want to sort (props, imports, types, decorators, modules..) but if you want to enforce something is sorted using ESLint, this is for you. It supports alphabetical and natural sorting, plus sorting by line length which results in this sort of aesthetic.
articles.author: Azat S.

articles.title: React Scan: Detect Performance Issues in Your App
articles.description: A pure JavaScript tool you can drop into your app to automatically ‘scan’ for problematic renders without doing lots of integration work. There’s a simple demo on the homepage or you can see Aiden’s view of Twitter/X being scanned. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Aiden Bai

articles.title: 💬 Discordeno v19: A Powerful Discord API Library
articles.description: A long-standing way to work with, and build bots for, the popular Discord chat system. v19 is a big update with breaking changes. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Discordeno Team

articles.title: 🤖 Vercel's AI Chatbot Starter Template
articles.description: An open source AI chatbot app template built using Next.js. It uses Vercel’s AI SDK and other Vercel APIs for the heavy lifting.
articles.author: Vercel

articles.title: Glide.js 3.7: A Dependency-Free Slider and Carousel Control
articles.description: “Designed to slide. No less, no more” says the creator. MIT licensed and mature.
articles.author: Jędrzej Chałubek

articles.description: 🗳️ The latest State of JS survey is now open and taking your responses. It's open until December 3.
🇫🇷 dotJS 2025 is taking place next April in Paris, France. If you'd like to speak, the CFP is open until November 29.
AWS Lambda, the serverless functions platform, turns ten years old this week. Its first runtime was JavaScript-based.
Nova is an interesting new JavaScript engine that takes a CPU cache friendly data-oriented approach.

Bun v1.1.35 – The fast JavaScriptCore-based runtime adds native support for Musl and Alpine Linux, the Bun binary is a lot smaller, console.group and groupEnd are now supported, and fs.readFile is faster on small files.
Payload 3.0 – Headless Next.js-native CMS platform.
📊 Mantine v7.14.0 – The popular React component suite adds new 'angle slider', radial bar chart, funnel chart, and stacking modal/drawer components.
Node.js v23.3.0 (Current) and v20.18.1 (LTS)
Ionic 8.4, ESLint v9.15.0, Turborepo 2.3, Deno 2.1, QuickJS 0.7
🤞 It wasn't released by the time we hit 'send' but we suspect TypeScript 5.7 will be out later today – you can check on the TypeScript blog.

articles.title: How overflow: clip Works in CSS
articles.description: This is a solid look at using the well-supported clip value alongside the overflow CSS property — with some good example use cases, particularly around art direction.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: Meet Angular v19
articles.description: The latest version of this popular web app framework is here — to mark the release ▶️ here’s a video running through what new features you can expect.
articles.author: Minko Gechev

articles.title: Importing a Frontend JavaScript Library Without a Build System
articles.description: Julia explores how to import a JS library when taking a no-build-system approach.
articles.author: Julia Evans

articles.title: alt Text: Don’t Just Describe Images
articles.description: Advice for writing alt text that communicates an image’s purpose without repeating page content — chiefly focus on meaning rather than visual description.
articles.author: Emma Cionca & Tanner Kohler

articles.title: Creating an ASCII Shader Using OGL
articles.description: This is an incredibly cool effect, not to mention great tutorial on getting started with shaders and using OGL, a minimal WebGL library that’s a lot lighter than Three.js.
articles.author: Andrico Karoulla

articles.title: ▶  Nerd Show and Tell: Meet Zach Leatherman
articles.description: Zach talks about the “rollercoaster ride of building Eleventy”, why owning your corner of the internet is more important than ever, and how platforms like Eleventy could be “the ticket to a new wave of web independence”.
articles.author: Podcast Awesome podcast

articles.title: SVG to Font 6.1: Read SVG Icons and Output a Font File
articles.description: Both a CLI tool and Node.js library that can read in SVG documents and output WOFF2, WOFF, EOT, TTF and SVG fonts. Useful for generating a Web font from a set of icons, say, as in this demo.
articles.author: Kenny Something

articles.title: lite-youtube Web Component v1.6 Released
articles.description: The latest version of this web component that quickly renders YouTube embeds adds auto-pausing, custom CSS properties, named slot thumbnails, and more.
articles.author: Justin Ribeiro

articles.title: SmarkForm: A Library for Creating Markup-Driven and Extendable Forms in Web Apps
articles.description: This allows you to add advanced features to forms, like JSON import/export, hotkeys, along with other interactive enhancements. Try some examples here.
articles.author: Joan Miquel Torres

articles.title: Coding Font: A 'Game' to Find Your New Favorite Code Font
articles.description: This is a fun idea. It throws over 25 popular developer-oriented fonts into a ‘tournament’ and you then pick your favorites until you’re left with a winner. (It was Cousine for me.)
articles.author: Typogram

articles.title: Monicon: A Universal Icon Library for Any JavaScript Framework
articles.description: The project itself is not new, but provides quick access to 200,000+ icons from popular sets and works with most frameworks and build tools.
articles.author: Oktay Şenkan
